intro: Rhodamnia dumetorum var. hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan rhodamnia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compact shrub form with woody stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
